meanings.definition: To surpass in painting skill or technique.
meanings.sent1: She always manages to outpaint her classmates in art class.
meanings.sent2: The artist was able to outpaint all others in the competition.
meanings.sent3: It's like she can outpaint with her eyes closed!
meanings.sent4: Her brushstrokes outpaint those of even the most experienced painters.
meanings.sent5: Watching her outpaint is like witnessing magic on canvas.

meanings.definition: To paint over or cover existing paint.
meanings.sent1: He decided to outpaint the old color with a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent2: The homeowner wanted to outpaint the chipped walls before selling the house.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally outpainted the door with the wrong color!
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist outpainted the previous mural with a new design.
meanings.sent5: She carefully outpainted each stroke to hide the imperfections underneath.

meanings.definition: The act of painting something outside.
meanings.sent1: Outdoor outpaint can be challenging due to weather conditions.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed the outpaint session in the park.
meanings.sent3: The outpaint event was a fun way to bring art to the community.
meanings.sent4: She organized an outpaint activity for the neighborhood kids.
meanings.sent5: The outpaint project brightened up the dull exterior of the building.
